meanings.definition: Knowledge acquired by study, research, etc.; learning.
meanings.sent1: Her erudition on ancient history impressed the professor.
meanings.sent2: His erudition in various subjects made him a respected scholar.
meanings.sent3: Despite his erudition, he still struggled with basic math problems.
meanings.sent4: Her erudition was a beacon of light in the darkness of ignorance.
meanings.sent5: The library was a treasure trove of erudition waiting to be explored.

meanings.sent1: The professor's erudition in philosophy was unmatched.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her erudition in the field of astrophysics.
meanings.sent3: His erudition in ancient languages was so deep that he could speak them fluently in his dreams.
meanings.sent4: The erudition of the old books in the library whispered secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed artifacts that reflected the erudition of ancient civilizations.
